info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Robeson, northwestern Dillon, northern Darlington and Marlboro Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Bishopville to Pembroke. Movement was north at 20 to 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Hartsville, Red Springs, Pembroke, Maxton, Mccoll, Clio, Rex, Mont Clare, Shannon, Buie, Wakulla, Chavistown, Floyd, Minturn, Elrod, North Hartsville, Dovesville, Raemon and Auburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
